definition: fractional currency (coin or note of value smaller than the country's unit of currency)/token (used instead of money for slot machines etc)

sentences.english: Should I buy a token each time?
sentences.chinese: 我每次都应该买辅币吗？

sentences.english: Ask the worker who sells tokens to give you one.
sentences.chinese: 给站在那边的售票员元，他会给你一个辅币。

sentences.english: Dimes and pennies are fractional currency.
sentences.chinese: 一角银币和分币都是辅币。

sentences.english: Just give the man standing there 3 yuan and he'll give you a token.
sentences.chinese: 给站在那边的售票员元，他会给你一个辅币。

sentences.english: What should I do with the token?
sentences.chinese: 我该怎么用这个辅币呢？

sentences.english: Can you give me change for a$10 note?
sentences.chinese: 你能替我把十美元钞票换成辅币吗？

sentences.english: You may buy many tokens at one time.
sentences.chinese: 您可以一次多买些辅币？

sentences.english: Precedent to the time using coins and Octopus cards, tram tickets were applied.
sentences.chinese: 在使用辅币和八达通前，乘搭电车是用车票。

sentences.english: You have to buy some tokens for the subway.
sentences.chinese: 您得购买一些乘地铁用的辅币。

definition: flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀圓|银圆/silver dollar
flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀元|银元/silver dollar
to cast (pour metal into a mold)
copper coin of the Ming and Qing Dynasties
